problem.markdown:
>>When calculating a mean residence time, which of the following is essential?<<
(x) steady state () existence of a positive feedback system () existence of a negative feedback system () presence of an introduced species () the presence of water
[explanation]
A fundamental assumption when calculating mean residence time is that the system of study is in steady state. This means that the inputs must be equal to the outputs.
[explanation]
